We chose Mexico thinking that this way we would be closer to Cuba and it would be easier for us to return when Machado fell. Manuela's mother had a friend who was able to arrange for the children to get false Spanish passports. Her father, Domingo, was not given a visa so could not travel with the family to Mexico. He travelled to Spain but died there so, after leaving Cuba, Manuela never saw her father again.
